unnormalised: Social Media & Influencer Marketing: Virality Trends
normalised: Social Media and Influencer Marketing: Virality Trends

unnormalised: Hey folks, ever wonder what makes something blow up online these days? Virality trends are changing faster than the flavours in a plate of biryani! This week, we're seeing a surge in short, relatable skits, think "Sharma Ji ka Beta" relatable.
normalised: Hey folks, ever wonder what makes something blow up online these days? Virality trends are changing faster than the flavours in a plate of biryani! This week, we're seeing a surge in short, relatable skits, think "Sharma Ji ka Beta" relatable.

unnormalised: Forget overly produced content. Authenticity is king, especially among Gen Z. Influencers are teaming up for collaborative posts – think Rahul and Priya doing a dance-off near Gateway of India, and it goes viral!
normalised: Forget overly produced content. Authenticity is king, especially among G-e-n Z. Influencers are teaming up for collaborative posts – think Rahul and Priya doing a dance-off near Gateway of India, and it goes viral!

unnormalised: Interestingly, audio-only content is making a comeback, fuelled by platforms like Clubhouse and X (formerly Twitter) Spaces. Think late-night discussions on IPL strategies reaching thousands.
normalised: Interestingly, audio-only content is making a comeback, fuelled by platforms like Clubhouse and X formerly Twitter Spaces. Think late-night discussions on I-P-L strategies reaching thousands.

unnormalised: Plus, brands are leveraging regional festivals, like Onam, to create engaging campaigns. Remember that saree brand campaign using Malayalam poetry? Genius! So, keep your eyes peeled and your content real to crack the virality code. Next week, we'll delve into the use of AI in predicting viral content - exciting times ahead!
normalised: Plus, brands are leveraging regional festivals, like Onam, to create engaging campaigns. Remember that saree brand campaign using Malayalam poetry? Genius! So, keep your eyes peeled and your content real to crack the virality code. Next week, we'll delve into the use of A-I in predicting viral content - exciting times ahead!
